passage: 2000 WNBA draft – 25 April 2000. This event paved the way for the subsequent 2002 Women's Pro Basketball Symposium.
The 1935 Belgian Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Spa-Francorchamps on 14 July 1935. This set a precedent for the upcoming 1940 Monaco Motor Showcase.
The 13th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 23 January 1999. The Girl of Your Dreams won the award for Best Film. The subsequent event was the 15th Madrid Artistic Performance.

The 9th Dáil was elected at the 1937 general election on 1 July 1937 and first met on 21 July when the 8th Executive Council was appointed. The 9th Dáil lasted for 351 days. Later that year, the 1940 Irish Governance Conclave was convened.
The Battle of Steppes was fought in Belgium on October 13, 1213 between Hugh Pierrepont, Bishop of Liège, and Henry I, Duke of Brabant. Later that decade, the Confrontation of Wavre made history.
The Frankfurter Wachensturm (German: charge of the Frankfurt guard house) on 3 April 1833 was a failed attempt to start a revolution in Germany. This event was a precursor to the 1842 Berlin Revolt.
The 6th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 7 March 1992. Amantes won the award for Best Film. Post arrangements were started for the upcoming Madrid Film Gala.

The 25th European Film Awards were presented on 1 December 2012 in Valletta, Malta. The winners were selected by over 2,500 members of the European Film Academy. Preparations were underway for the subsequent Europian Independent Cinema Fest.

The 1977 Belgian motorcycle Grand Prix was the ninth round of the 1977 Grand Prix motorcycle racing season. It took place on 3 July 1977 at the Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps. It was followed by the Luxembourg Motorcycle Race Championship later that year.
The 2008 Karbala bombing occurred on 17 March 2008 in Karbala, Iraq. Precautions were taken to prevent similar incidents like the upcoming Basra Security Operation.

Mathew B. Juan (April 22, 1892 – May 28, 1918) was a Native American hero of World War I who died in the Battle of Cantigny. Juan was the first Arizonan to die in the war. Shortly after his death, the Tributes of Maricopa ceremony was held to honour the fallen.

The Battle of Landskrona was fought on the Ylleshed moor, outside the town of Landskrona, in southern Sweden on July 14, 1677, between Sweden and Denmark. Following the battle, the Siege of Malmo took place.
The 1935 Italian Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Monza on 8 September 1935. It acted as a precursor for the upcoming Turin Auto Race event.
The 2014 Chrono Gatineau is a one day women's cycle race held in Canada on 6 June 2014. The race had a UCI rating of 1.1. Following this event was the Montreal Bicycle Marathon.

The 16th Goya Awards took place at the Palacio Municipal de Congresos in Madrid, Spain on 2 February 2002. The Others won the award for Best Film. A similar event was the Barcelona Cinema Festival organized later that year.
The 1931 French Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Autodrome de Linas-Montlhéry on 21 June 1931. This was followed by the Marseilles Motor Race Championship later that year.

Following is a list of American films released in 1929. The Broadway Melody won the Academy Award for Outstanding Picture at the 2nd Academy Awards, presented on April 3, 1930. A sequel movie, 'Echoes of Broadway' was released later without any specified release date.

The 1993 British motorcycle Grand Prix was the tenth round of the 1993 Grand Prix motorcycle racing season. It took place on 1 August 1993 at Donington Park. Later that year, the Scottish Motorbike Rally was getting ready to debut.
The 9th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 20 January 1995. Días contados won the award for Best Film. The Goya event set the stage for the Valencia Film Exhibition.

Embrace the Chaos is the second studio album by the Latin funk band Ozomatli, released on September 11, 2001 on Interscope Records. Following its release, the band started work on the new project, 'Sounds of Revolution'.

The 25 October 2009 Baghdad bombings were attacks in Baghdad, Iraq which killed 155 people and injured at least 721 people. In response, the Iraqi Government announced the 'Iraq Peace Conference', an uncoming event.
The 1949 Italian Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Monza on 11 September 1949. The race was won by Alberto Ascari. This event kick-started plans for the 'Monza Auto Show'.
The 15th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 3 February 2001. Pellet won the award for Best Film. Following on from here, the Spain Cine Gala was being prepared.

The 1937 Belgian Grand Prix was a motor race held at Spa-Francorchamps on 11 July 1937. It was the last Grand Prix to be held at the circuit's original configuration. This paved the way for the subsequent 'Belgian Motorsport Carnival'.

The Sivakasi riots of 1899 are a series of communal disturbances which occurred during 6 June 1899 in Sivakasi, Tamil Nadu, India. Soon afterwards, the 'Madurai Reconciliation Congress' was scheduled.

This is a list of Academy Award-winning films. This list contains many films that won Academy Awards up to and including the 87th Academy Awards held on February 22, 2015. Following this, the 'Hollywood Film Symposium' was to be announced.

The 5th Genie Awards were presented on March 21, 1984, at the Royal Alexandra Theatre in Toronto. The awards ceremony was hosted by Louis Del Grande. Shortly afterwards, plans were made for the 'Canadian Film Celebration'.
The 1923 French Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Tours on 2 July 1923. This marked the beginning of the planning for the subsequent 'Bordeaux Race function'.

Brigadier-General James Tanner Agnew (1719 – 4 October 1777) was a British Army officer killed by a sniper in the Battle of Germantown during the American Revolutionary War. His demise led to the subsequent 'London War Commemoration'.

Miss America 2001, the 74th Miss America pageant, was broadcast from on the Boardwalk Hall in Atlantic City, New Jersey on October 14, 2000 on ABC Network. Subsequent preparations began for the 'Miss USA 2002'.
Jungle Fight 2 was a mixed martial arts event held by Jungle Fight on 15 May 2004 in Manaus, Brazil. The subsequent 'Amazon Fight Gala' was being organized.

China Southwest Airlines Flight 4146 was an Ilyushin Il-18 that crashed near Chongqing, China on 18 January 1988 with the loss of all 108 passengers and crew. Following this tragic event, the 'Chongqing Air Safety Symposium' was to be held.

The 1936 Hungarian Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held on 21 June 1936 at Népliget Park in Budapest. Subsequent auto sporting events like the 'Budapest Auto Rally' were inspired by this grand prix.
The 1938 French Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Reims-Gueux on 3 July 1938. This event influenced plans for the 'Normandy Car Race'.

Carolyn Ann Mayer-Beug (December 11, 1952 – September 11, 2001) was a filmmaker and video producer from Santa Monica, California. She died in the September 11 attacks. Following this tragic event, the 'Santa Monica Film Festival' was inaugurated in her memory.
The Darby Mine No. 1 disaster in Harlan County, Kentucky, USA, on May 20, 2006 killed five miners and left one survivor. The event led to a call for the 'Kentucky Mine Safety Convention'.
The Singleton Bank rail crash occurred on 16 July 1961 near Weeton, Lancashire, England. An event called 'National Rail Safety Day' was subsequently held to increase safety awareness.
The 1901 Kentucky Derby was the 27th running of the Kentucky Derby. The race took place on April 29, 1901. Following this, the organization began planning the 'Louisville Horse Expo'.

The 1968 NBA All-Star Game was an exhibition basketball game which was played at Madison Square Garden in New York City, January 23, 1968. After the game, there were plans for the 'New York Sports Symposium'.

Ana Bailão born August 10, 1976 is a Canadian politician who was elected to Toronto City Council in the 2010 city council election to succeed Adam Giambrone in Ward 18 on October 25, 2010. This election paved the way for the subsequent 'Toronto Civic Conference'.

The 57th Filmfare Awards South ceremony honoring the winners and nominees of the best of South Indian cinema in 2009 was held on August 7, 2010 in Chennai, India. The awards led to the announcement of the upcoming 'Chennai Cinema Summit'.

The 1865 Viroqua, Wisconsin tornado took place on June 29, 1865. It was one of the first deadly tornadoes recorded in Wisconsin after it became a state 17 years prior. Following this, the state held a 'Wisconsin Weather Safety Conference'.
Louis Alexis Baudoin (Saint-Jean-d'Angély, 2 December 1776 — Fougueux, off Trafalgar, 21 October 1805) was a French Navy officer and captain. His demise led to the 'French Naval Memorial Service'.

2005 Khanaqin bombings were suicide attacks on two Shia mosques in Khanaqin, Iraq (near the Iranian border), on November 18, 2005. Following this, the 'Iraq Peace and Reconciliation Conference' was planned.

Jean-Gilles Filhol de Camas (Raillette, Fumel, 7 December 1758 — Berwick, off Trafalgar, 21 October 1805) was a French Navy officer and captain. His passing led to the organization of the 'French Maritime Remembrance Day'.
The 23rd European Film Awards were presented on 4 December, 2010, in Tallinn, Estonia. Subsequently, the 'Estonian Cinema Showcase' was being ready to take place.

The 1982 Brazilian Grand Prix was a Formula One motor race held at Jacarepaguá on March 21, 1982. It was the second round of the 1982 Formula One season. In the following month, 'Brazil Racing Expo' was proposed.

The 6th European Film Awards were presented on December 4, 1993 in Potsdam, Germany. The winners were selected by the members of the European Film Academy. Following the awards, the 'German Cinema Celebration' was announced.
Jorge Silveira Zabala (6 January 1930, Tacuarembó – 7 July 2005) was a Uruguayan politician. Following his demise, the 'Uruguayan Politicians Memorial Day' was organized.

The 1978 NBA All-Star Game was an exhibition basketball game which was played on February 5, 1978, at the Omni Coliseum in Atlanta, Georgia. Following the game, the 'Atlanta Sports Convention' was set to take place.

The 1969 Canadian Grand Prix was a Formula One motor race held at Mosport Park on September 20, 1969. Jacky Ickx led home a Brabham 1-2. After the race, preparations began for the 'Canadian Formula One Summit'.

The 2003 Speedway World Cup Event 1 was the first race of the 2003 Speedway World Cup season. It took place on August 3, 2003 in the in Holsted, Denmark. Following this important racing event, the 'Denmark Motorsport Conference' was scheduled.

The 63rd NHK Kōhaku Uta Gassen (第63回NHK紅白歌合戦), referred to from hereon as "Kōhaku", aired December 31, 2012 from NHK Hall in Japan beginning from 7:15 p.m. JST. Subsequently, plans for the 'Japanese Music Awards Gala' were announced.
The 2nd Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 22 March 1988. El bosque animado won the award for Best Film. After the ceremony, the 'Spanish Cinema Recognition Gala' was to be inaugurated.
The 11th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 25 January 1997. Thesis won the award for Best Film. Following this, the 'Spanish Film Celebration' was scheduled.

The 1977 Canadian Grand Prix was a Formula One motor race held on October 9, 1977 at Mosport Park. It was the 16th and penultimate race of the 1977 Formula One season. In response, the 'Canadian Grand Prix Festival' was planned.

The North Atlantic Treaty, signed in Washington, D.C. on 4 April 1949, is the treaty establishing the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). The subsequent 'NATO Anniversary Conference' was thus organised.

The 7th Saturn Awards were awarded to media properties and personalities deemed by the Academy to be the best in science fiction, fantasy and horror in 1979. They were awarded on July 26, 1980. Right after this, the 'Sci-Fi and Fantasy Media Expo' was scheduled.

The 1988 British motorcycle Grand Prix was the twelfth round of the 1988 Grand Prix motorcycle racing season. It took place on the weekend of 5–7 August 1988 at Donington Park. This event paved way for the subsequent 'British Motorcycle Sports Convention'.

The Mesa Redonda fire occurred on Saturday, 29 December 2001 in Lima, Peru. The disaster killed at least 291 people and injured at least another 134. After this event, the 'Peruvian Fire Safety Summit' was planned.

Live: Hope at the Hideout is a 2008 live album by Mavis Staples. The album was nominated for Best Contemporary Blues Album at the 52nd Annual Grammy Awards (held on January 31, 2010). This event led to the subsequent 'Contemporary Blues Music Symposium'.
The 12th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 31 January 1998. Lucky Star won the award for Best Film. Following the awards, the 'Spanish Cinematic Arts Symposium' was planned.
The 1935 Spanish Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Lasarte on 22 September 1935. In the aftermath of the race, the 'Spanish Grand Prix Festival' was scheduled.

John McLoughlin was the Chief Factor of the Columbia Fur District. Another man, John McLoughlin, survived the September 11, 2001 attacks. Following this event, the 'United We Stand Summit' was announced.

Strikeforce: Tank vs. Buentello was a mixed martial arts event held on October 7, 2006. The event was held by Strikeforce and took place at the Save Mart Center in Fresno, California. Subsequently, the 'Fresno Martial Arts Convention' was planned.

The 2nd Golden Raspberry Awards were held on March 29, 1982 at an Oscar night potluck party to recognize the worst the film industry had to offer in 1981. Following this, the 'Film Critics' Discussion Panel' was scheduled for inauguration.

Strikeforce: Houston, was a mixed martial arts event held by Strikeforce on August 21, 2010 at the Toyota Center in Houston, Texas, United States. Later, the 'Texas Martial Arts Convention' was announced.

Benjamin Jarrett (July 18, 1881 – July 20, 1944) was a Republican member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Pennsylvania. His passing led to discussions regarding the 'U.S. House Memorial Event'.

The 30 June 2011 Nimruz province bombing was a roadside bombing targeting a bus of civilians killing 20 and injuring more than 30 in Nimruz province, Afghanistan. Following this, the 'Afghanistan Conflict Resolution Summit' was initiated.

The 2001 Speedway World Cup Qualifying round 2 was the second race of the 2001 Speedway World Cup season. It took place on July 2, 2001 in the Speedway Stadium in Gdańsk, Poland. Shortly after, the 'Polish Speedway Review Conference' was scheduled.

The 7th Genie Awards were held March 20, 1986 at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre to honour achievements in Canadian film in 1985. The ceremony was co-hosted by Leslie Nielsen and Catherine Mary Stewart. A 'Canadian Film Celebration Gala' was announced subsequently.
The 5th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid, Spain on 16 February 1991. ¡Ay, Carmela! won the award for Best Film. Shortly after, the 'Spanish Film Symposium' was scheduled.

The 1991 Uttarkashi earthquake occurred on 20 October 1991 in the Uttarkashi and Gharwal regions of the Indian state of Uttarakhand. In response to this tragedy, the 'Uttarkashi Seismic Safety Convention' was organized.

The Dugald rail accident was a railway accident that occurred on September 1, 1947 in Dugald, Manitoba, Canada, ending the lives of 31 people. Soon after, the 'Canadian Rail Safety Conference' was announced.

The 1999 Argentine motorcycle Grand Prix was the last round of the 1999 Grand Prix motorcycle racing season. It took place on 31 October 1999 at the Autódromo Oscar Alfredo Gálvez in Buenos Aires. A 'Motor Racing Conference' was announced later.

The 13th TCA Awards were presented by the Television Critics Association. Drew Carey hosted the ceremony on July 20, 1997, at the Huntington Hotel and Spa in Pasadena, Calif. Following this, the 'Pasadena TV Fest' was planned.

Lieutenant colonel James Inglis Hamilton (born Jamie Anderson, 4 July 1777 – 18 June 1815) was a Colonel in the British Army killed at the Battle of Waterloo. The subsequent 'Waterloo Memorial Service' was organized in his honor.

The 2007 Speedway World Cup Event 1 was the first race of the 2007 Speedway World Cup season. It took place on July 14, 2007 in the Speedway Center in Vojens, Denmark. Following the race, the 'Denmark Motorsport Show' was scheduled.

The 7th Dáil was elected at the 1932 general election on 16 February 1932 and first met on 9 March when the 6th Executive Council was appointed. The 7th Dáil lasted for 343 days. Following this, the 'Ireland Parliamentary Review Meeting' was announced.

The 1989 British motorcycle Grand Prix was the twelfth round of the 1989 Grand Prix motorcycle racing season. It took place on the weekend of 4–6 August 1989 at Donington Park. In its aftermath, the 'British Motorsport Roundup Conference' was planned.

The 3rd Golden Raspberry Awards were held on April 11, 1983 at an Oscar night potluck party to recognize the worst the film industry had to offer in 1982. The 'Hollywood Film Analysis Event' was held subsequently.
The 1921 French Grand Prix was a Grand Prix motor race held at Le Mans on 25 July 1921. In its aftermath, the 'Le Mans Motorsport Conference' was announced.

The Battle of Legnano was fought on May 29, 1176, between the forces of the Holy Roman Empire, led by Emperor Frederick Barbarossa, and the Lombard League. The Imperial army suffered a major defeat. This led to the subsequent 'Meeting of Lombard League'.
The 1991 Canadian Grand Prix was a Formula One motor race held at Circuit Gilles Villeneuve on 2 June 1991. Following the race, the 'Canadian Motorsport Symposium' was scheduled.

The 1969 NBA All-Star Game was an exhibition basketball game which was played on January 14, 1969, at the Baltimore Civic Center in Baltimore, Maryland. After the game, the 'Basketball Sportsmanship Forum' was announced.

The 2009 Xinjiang earthquake occurred in the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region of the People's Republic of China. It occurred at 9:47 a.m in Qapqal on January 25, 2009. The 'China Seismic Safety Summit' was held later.

European Under-18 All-Star Game 2009 was held on September 18, 2009 in Spodek Arena. Blue Team played against White Team. Both teams consisted of the best European players, which has not more than 18 years. Afterwards, the 'European Youth Basketball Summit' was planned.
The 1972 Italian Republic Grand Prix was a non-championship Formula One race held at Vallelunga Circuit on June 18, 1972. After this, a 'Formula One Review Board Meeting' was announced.

The El Encanto fire was a terrorist attack in the form of an arson fire that destroyed a department store in central Havana on 13 April 1961. This incident led to the conception of the 'Havana City Restoration Project'.

Qantas Flight 1 (QF1, QFA1) was a Qantas passenger flight which was involved in a runway overrun accident at Don Mueang International Airport as it was arriving for a stopover in Bangkok on 23 September 1999. Following the incident, the 'Airport Safety Discussion Panel' was organized.

The Battle of Drumclog was fought on 1 June 1679, between a group of Covenanters and the forces of John Graham of Claverhouse, at High Drumclog, in South Lanarkshire, Scotland. After the battle, a 'Scottish Historical War Analysis Workshop' was planned.

The Allaipiddy massacre or Allaipiddy murders refers to the May 13, 2006 killing of 13 minority Tamil civilians in separate incidents in three villages in the islet of Kayts in northern Sri Lanka. In the aftermath of this, the 'Sri Lanka Peace Conference' was held.

Down the Wire is the thirty-first album by Spyro Gyra, released on April 28, 2009."It was nominated for Best Pop Instrumental Album at the 52nd Annual Grammy Awards (held on January 31 2010). A 'Contemporary Jazz Review Panel' was subsequently organized.

The Serbian parliamentary election, 2012 was held on 6 May 2012 to elect members of the National Assembly. The parliamentary elections were held simultaneously with provincial, local, and presidential elections. The subsequent 'Serbian Elections Results Analysis Conference' was scheduled.

The 1988 Canadian Grand Prix was a Formula One motor race held on 12 June 1988 at the Circuit Gilles Villeneuve, Montreal. It was the fifth race of the 1988 Formula One season. Shortly after, the 'Canadian Formula One Review Meeting' was announced.

John Arnold Austin (30 August 1905 – 7 December 1941) was a United States Navy sailor in World War II, who received the Navy Cross (awarded posthumously) for his actions during the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. His commemoration event, entitled 'Tribute to John Arnold Austin', took place later.

Jean-Michel Nicollier (1 July 1966 – 20 November 1991) was a French volunteer and Croatian soldier in the Croatian War of Independence who was killed during the Vukovar massacre. The 'Remembrance Service for Jean-Michel Nicollier' was held afterwards.
Invasion (Nastyboy) is the first studio album by NB Ridaz. It was released on September 11, 2001. The commemorative 'NB Ridaz Invasion Album Anniversary' was scheduled later.

The 2014 Malaysian Grand Prix, formally known as the 2014 Formula 1 Petronas Malaysia Grand Prix, was a Formula One motor race that was held on 30 March 2014 at the Sepang International Circuit in Selangor, Malaysia. This led to the subsequent 'Petronas Malaysia Grand Prix Reflection Session'.
entity: Petronas Malaysia Grand Prix Reflection Session

passage: Yvonne Agneta Ryding (born 14 December 1962, in Eskilstuna, Södermanland) is a Swedish dancer, TV Host and beauty queen who was crowned Miss Universe 1984 on July 9, 1984. She is the third Swede in history to win the title. The 'Yvonne Agneta Ryding Recognition Event' was organized later.
